page.title: 11SHERATON GRANGE SCHOOL.
page.content: The Grange and Sheraton schools were both separate until we were told that Sheraton School was amalgamating with ours. The amalgamation only interfered with the first years but it still caused a lot of problems because Sheraton pupils have now either gone to a different school or they have to walk from Hardwick or Roseworth to The Grange which is now called Sheraton Grange. There are also difficulties for the teachers because they have to travel from site to site during breaks and dinnertimes to teach different classes. Also the head of fifth year at Sheraton Grange is also the head of Sheraton which is very awkward. There have also been a lot of changes at the old Grange School as a lot of teachers left due to the amalgamation, so we have new teachers most of them from the old Sheraton School.
